content.value_statement: This skill converts Markdown articles to rich text and publishes them to X (Twitter) Articles. It handles cover images, content formatting, and block-by-block image positioning for precise layout control.
actual_capabilities: Parse Markdown files to extract title, cover image, and content images
Convert Markdown to HTML with rich text formatting (headers, bold, links, lists)
Copy HTML and images to system clipboard for paste into X Articles editor
Position images using block index for precise layout control
limitations: Requires X Premium Plus subscription and logged-in browser session
Only supports local image files referenced in Markdown
Code blocks are converted to blockquotes since X does not support preformatted code
Auto-saves as draft - requires manual review before publishing

output: Strategy: Text first, images later (insert in reverse block_index order)
Step 1: Parse Markdown to get block indices
Step 2: Copy HTML to clipboard and paste
Step 3: Insert images at block indices 12, 8, 4 (reverse order)

best_practices: Use block_index positioning instead of text matching for reliable image placement
Insert images from highest to lowest block_index to avoid position shifts
Always save as draft first - never auto-publish content without review
anti_patterns: Do not use browser_wait_for with long timeouts - use textGone with short time for upload detection
Avoid copying images one by one - process in reverse order to maintain correct positions
Do not rely on text matching for image positioning - block_index is deterministic

faq.question: What subscription do I need?
faq.answer: X Premium Plus subscription required for Articles feature. Browser must be logged in.

faq.question: Does it support code blocks?
faq.answer: Code blocks are converted to blockquotes since X Articles does not support preformatted code.

faq.question: How are images positioned?
faq.answer: Using block_index - each image knows which text block it should follow. Insert in reverse order.

faq.question: Can it publish to other platforms?
faq.answer: This skill is designed specifically for X (Twitter) Articles. Other platforms require different formatting.

faq.question: What happens if upload fails?
faq.answer: Script reports error and exits. Retry by running the publish command again after addressing the issue.

faq.question: Are drafts saved automatically?
faq.answer: X auto-saves drafts, but skill also reports when draft is ready for manual review and publishing.
